page_analysis.text_content:
Allowable daylight plane protrusions summary

Feature                      Allowable protrusion                                             Illustration

Television and radio antennas  up to 15' above maximum building height

Chimneys and flues < 5' wide  may extend beyond the daylight plane to meet minimum required clearance of Building Code (Chapter 16.04)  Fig 20 on p. 26

Dormers, roof decks, gables, or similar architectural features  each feature ≤ 7.5' long and cumulative length of all features ≤ 15' with min 5' separation between features (on each side); height ≤ 24';  Fig 20 on p. 26 & Fig 23 on p. 28

Cornices, eaves, and similar architectural features (excluding flat or continuous walls or enclosures usable for interior space)  max 2'  Fig 22 on p. 27

visual_elements.description: A summary table listing features, their allowable protrusions beyond the daylight plane, and references to illustrations. The table has three columns: Feature, Allowable protrusion, and Illustration. Features include Television and radio antennas, Chimneys and flues < 5' wide, Dormers/roof decks/gables or similar architectural features, and Cornices/eaves and similar architectural features. Each row details the maximum allowable protrusion and references to figures on other pages.

Dormers, roof decks, gables minimum separation
technical_specifications.unit: feet (minimum separation between features on each side)

Cornices, eaves, and similar architectural features protrusion

No handwritten annotations, stamps, or markings visible.
Text is clear and legible with no quality issues.
